etymologies: 1930s; earliest use found in American Journal of Surgery. From pneumono- + -lysis

definitions: The freeing of a lung from adhesions; (more fully "intrapleural pneumonolysis") lysis of adhesions within the pleural cavity; (also) (in full "extrapleural pneumonolysis") the surgical stripping of the parietal pleura and adherent lung from the chest wall; an instance of this.
